Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <TonyL> 1) Open other cmd terminal window
2) Navigate to folder where you have husd and hush-cli by `cd foldername`
3) Type `.\hush-cli getaccountaddress ""` in terminal and press Enter

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <penguin> CLI = Command Line Interface
so you will need to operate this wallet by sending commands to it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <TonyL> HUSH moved into Komodo ecosystem as komodo assetchain and changed code upstream from ZEC to KMD https://github.com/MyHush/hush-v3-whitepaper/blob/master/hush-v3.pdf (section 7)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <TonyL> Definition of assetchain is something like a:
```A Parallel Chain (often refered to as Assetchain) is a independently created blockchain (by a user, business or any other 3rd party) that inherits all of Komodo's features```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Heno1974> can I copy my address from there?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> to view your address, you will need to send same command to the `hushd`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> wallet.dat is your wallet file, which stores this address and the private key that gives access to your address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <penguin> to put your address in file, try this
`.\hush-cli getaccountaddress "" > hush.txt`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <penguin> to export your privatekey, try this
`.\hush-cli dumpprivkey "ADDRESS-HERE" > hushkey.txt`
